LayoutNode.Content: Aviation Industry Corporation of China (Abbreviate: AVIC, Chinese: 中国航空工业集团公司) is a Chinese state-owned aerospace and defense company.
LayoutNode.SRC: Aviation Industry Corporation of China (Abbreviate: AVIC, Chinese: 中国航空工业集团公司) is a Chinese state-owned aerospace and defense company.

• 1 History
    • 1.1 Split
    • 1.2 Merge
• 2 Business segments
• 3 Major affiliate companies
• 5 External links

LayoutNode.Content: Since being established on April 17, 1951 during the Korean War as the Aviation Industry Administration Commission, the aviation industry of The People's Republic of China has been through 12 systemic reforms. AVIC recently purchased aircraft engine manufacturer Continental Motors, Inc. of the USA.
LayoutNode.SRC: Since being established on April 17, 1951 during the Korean War as the Aviation Industry Administration Commission, the aviation industry of The People's Republic of China has been through 12 systemic reforms. AVIC recently purchased aircraft engine manufacturer Continental Motors, Inc. of the USA.

LayoutNode.Content: China Aviation Industry Corporation (Chinese: 中国航空工业总公司) was a Chinese consortium of aircraft manufacturers. On July 1, 1999, this consortium was split into AVIC I and AVIC II.
LayoutNode.SRC: China Aviation Industry Corporation (Chinese: 中国航空工业总公司) was a Chinese consortium of aircraft manufacturers. On July 1, 1999, this consortium was split into AVIC I and AVIC II.

LayoutNode.Content: On October 28, 2008, AVIC I and AVIC II officially merged because the previous separation resulted in split resources and led to redundant projects. The major focus of AVIC is to efficiently develop indigenous military technologies and to eventually compete with Boeing and Airbus in the civilian airline industry.
LayoutNode.SRC: On October 28, 2008, AVIC I and AVIC II officially merged because the previous separation resulted in split resources and led to redundant projects. The major focus of AVIC is to efficiently develop indigenous military technologies and to eventually compete with Boeing and Airbus in the civilian airline industry.

LayoutNode.Content: During the Airshow China 2008, AVIC appeared to the public for the first time.
LayoutNode.SRC: During the Airshow China 2008, AVIC appeared to the public for the first time.
